data.title: Expand selection, a level to not include quotes
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2 (1.12.2)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type a string without quotes: `"this is a string"`
2. Place cursor in between `i` and `s` of the word `is`
3. Press Ctrl + Cmd + Shift + Right - it will expand to include the quotes

Expected results:

If we expand the selection when there are quotes around it, the selection gets expanded to include the quotes. Can we please get a level before the quotes. So if I my cursor is in the middle of a string surrounded by quotes, if I expand once it will just get what is within the quotes, expanding a second time then includes the quotes. This is how it worked on my other editors before I moved to VSCode.

data.title: Synchronize Markdown editor and preview tabs

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Please implement automatic switching of the preview tab when one switches the editor tab while editing Markdown files.

Bonus points for the ability to automatically open the preview tab when opening a Markdown file.

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 64-bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open two Markdown files and two preview windows.
2. Switch between the edit tabs and make critical changes.
3. Wonder what your output looks like.
4. Panic.

data.title: TypeScript imports breaking out over multiple lines on format
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. built in formatter for typescript
2. use eyes to see that imports break out.

From this: 
```
import { mr } from '../../app/mr';
import { Database, Globals } from '../../providers';
import { Component, OnInit, ViewChild } from '@angular/core';
import { NgForm } from '@angular/forms';
```

To this:
```
import {
  mr
} from '../../app/mr';
import {
  Database,
  Globals
} from '../../providers';
import {
  Component,
  OnInit,
  ViewChild
} from '@angular/core';
import {
  NgForm
} from '@angular/forms';
```

data.title: Fix #27980 — make selected tab lighter than others in Monokai themes
data.body:
This fixes #27980 by swapping tab colors: the selected tab is now lighter than others.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/327323/26756108/da2af380-489b-11e7-8db8-a7405a8beb0b.png)

data.title: Monokai tab bar colors are inverted, making it hard to tell which file is edited
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open two files in tabs.
2. Set color scheme to Monokai (or Monokai Dimmed).
3. Which one is currently being edited? Because the open file is dark grey, the non-open file is light grey, and the rest of the tab bar is dark grey, the file that stands out and **seems** to be edited is 2. Which it isn’t.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/327323/26755982/e4739426-4898-11e7-83e6-8099e9e70f17.png)

data.title: Consider disabling minimap in output
data.body:
See discussion at https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/24735#issuecomment-305712978

If we don't disable we should use the same background color as the editor.

/cc @bpasero

data.title: Theme: Disabled list element

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: The extensions list apply transparency to a disabled extension, but we can't control the disabled list element. In this case, i have a list with a low-contrast color and only the transparency is not enough to highlight disabled list item. **Color Info and empty-indent are disabled** I think it could be awesome have a way to styling the disabled list element inside all list that can be have disabled items. I can suggest `list.disabledForeground` and `list.disabledBackground`

data.title: Include support for system-wide mandatory/default settings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install vscode as an administrator
2. Launch vscode as a different (regular) user

It is currently not possible for an administrator to define mandatory and/or default settings that apply to all users/workspaces. This would be very helpful in a corporate/enterprise setting where we want users to have a consistent experience, or where the infrastructure demands certain configs (e.g. `"update.channel": "none"`).

Suggestion:
a) Define an environment variable that points to a json file with mandatory settings, which override user/workspace settings.
b) Define another environment variable that points to a json file with default settings, which get copied to the user settings file when a user launches vscode for the first time.

If suggestion a) is difficult to implement I will settle for b) and use an extension (e.g. [Fetch User Environment](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=michaelnewton.fetch-user-environment)) to manage the mandatory settings.

data.title: Allow switching the opened folder to a relative folder more easily
data.body:
Currently, switching to a different directory takes a few seconds, and I believe it reloads the entire window. It'd be better in my opinion if we had a tree-like structure on the left panel and could simply click `..` to go to the parent directory.

The current system therefore stays the same, only the addition of the `..` link to go to parent directory, and the option to double click a child directory to navigate to it and make it working repository.

Edit: Feature is nonexistant in Atom

data.title: Next group action should not create new group
data.body:
Fix for #12833 
Next group action will just circle back to the first group instead of adding new group.
That's what already happens for Prev group action: if you're on group1 it will just go to the last group and will not create group3 automatically.

data.title: Allow paths as input to Save and Save As
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu

It would be great if while adding new files we give the absolute path of the new file in the file name and VSCode instead of saying invalid filename, could automatically create the folders mentioned in the path if they are not present. This feature can have a key shortcut similar to how filename pattern search works with Ctrl + p.

data.title: Please create meaningful error messages
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.8.0|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0|
|code-runner|formulahendry|0.6.18|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.10.0|
|mono-debug|ms-vscode|0.15.5|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.2|
|open-in-browser|techer|1.0.0|
|iis-express|warren-buckley|1.0.0|;


---
Please crate a better error message. You do not really expect me to count characters, do you?
So where in the example below is position 449? Please print the line number instead.

Kind regards, Lord Saumagen.

Steps to Reproduce:

Open a JSON file and create an error.

data.title: Option to disable quick fix
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-Insider
- OS Version: Manjaro Gellivara 17.0.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a C# file.
2. Start writing anything.
3. Every time you type a character, the light bulb on the left will flash off, then flash back again.

![shot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5387404/26749209/3ffe2970-47bb-11e7-9d1b-d092ca9a7ef8.jpg)

This is extremely irritating. I'd rather not get any suggestions at all.

4. (optional) Actually follow the suggestions.

![shot2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5387404/26749240/b5bd8f16-47bb-11e7-984f-3ec4b39a25ea.jpg)

See also #14840.

data.title: Add a "landing page" feature to tasks

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body: While you're working on the task features, I'd like to request that tasks have a property that can specify what pane to open when the task completes. For instance, I'd like my test task to land the user on the problems pane to view the problems surfaced by the problem matcher.

data.title: Goto line: Expand collapsed block if the target line is inside of one
data.body:
When using `CTRL+G` to go to a line that is inside a collapsed block, VSCode does not expand it automatically.

It would aid a bit in productivity if it did.

data.title: PhpUnit throw errors and fail with integrated terminal
data.body:
i've reported an issue like this and i will leave the url.
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23103

- VSCode Version: 1.12
- OS Version: Mac Os X el capitan V. 10.11.6
- PHP Version: 5.3.29_27
- PhpUnit version: 3.7.38

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open VScode integrated terminal and run the unit test

*User History*

When i tried to run the unit test from the integrated terminal throws errors and fail when it supposed to only 1 will [Error Screenshot](http://imgur.com/RYw5shS)
but, when i open a native terminal (cmd + space and type terminal) and tried to run the test no errors appear and fail the test that is supposed to fail.
